lead_paragraph: The shooting at an art exhibit, said to be carried out by a 22-year-old police officer, forced Turkey and Russia to confront a new crisis tied directly to the Syrian conflict.

byline.contributor: Tim Arango reported from Istanbul, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Ivan Nechepurenko, Oleg Matsnev and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow, Safak Timur and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, Sewell Chan from London, Gardiner Harris from Washington and Bryant Rousseau from New York.
byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and RICK GLADSTONE

headline.print_headline: Russia’s Envoy Gunned Down By Lone Turk
headline.main: Russian Ambassador to Turkey Is Assassinated in Ankara

snippet: The shooting at an art exhibit, said to be carried out by a 22-year-old police officer, forced Turkey and Russia to confront a new crisis tied directly to the Syrian conflict....
abstract: Russian ambassador to Turkey Andrey G Karlov is assassinated at art exhibit in Ankara by lone off-duty police officer in what officials are calling terrorist act; assassin shouts about Aleppo and Syria before he dies in shootout with police; experts say assassination is likely to link Russia and Turkey closer together, rather than drive them further apart.
